          Evidence 
          X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Solution

          Ensure that your web server, application server, load balancer, etc. is configured to suppress "X-Powered-By" headers.
        8. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/categories.php
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • WSTG-v42-INFO-08
          • OWASP_2017_A03

<div id="content">
	<h2 id="pageName">Disclaimer</h2>
	  <div class="story">
		<h6>Please read carefully</h6>
		<p>This website is created to demonstrate the abilities of Acunetix new product <strong>WEB Vulnerability Scanner</strong>.</p>
		It is not intended to be a real online shop. Also this website was constructed with common web programming errors so it is buggy.
		<p>Please do not post any confidential information on this site. Do not give any creditcard number or real address, nor e-mail or
		website addresses.</p>
		<p>Information you post on this site are by no means private nor protected!</p>
		<p>All images on this site were generated with fre software <a href="http://www.eclectasy.com/Fractal-Explorer/index.html" target="_blank">
		<strong>Fractal Explorer</strong></a>.</p>
	  </div>
</div>

<!--end content -->

<div style="background-color:lightgray;width:100%;text-align:center;font-size:12px;padding:1px">
<p style="padding-left:5%;padding-right:5%"><b>Warning</b>: This is not a real shop. This is an example PHP application, which is intentionally vulnerable to web attacks. It is intended to help you test Acunetix. It also helps you understand how developer errors and bad configuration may let someone break into your website. You can use it to test other tools and your manual hacking skills as well. Tip: Look for potential SQL Injections, Cross-site Scripting (XSS), and Cross-site Request Forgery (CSRF), and more.</p>
</div>

<!-- InstanceEnd --></html>
          Evidence 
          X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Solution

          Ensure that your web server, application server, load balancer, etc. is configured to suppress "X-Powered-By" headers.
        10. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/guestbook.php
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • WSTG-v42-INFO-08
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          The web/application server is leaking information via one or more "X-Powered-By" HTTP response headers. Access to such information may facilitate attackers identifying other frameworks/components your web application is reliant upon and the vulnerabilities such components may be subject to.
          Request
          Request line and header section (256 bytes) 
          GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/guestbook.php HTTP/1.1
Host: testphp.vulnweb.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:92.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/92.0
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Referer: http://testphp.vulnweb.com
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (200 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.19.0
Date: Thu, 20 Jan 2022 18:42:48 GMT
Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
Connection: keep-alive
X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Response body (5390 bytes) 
          <!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01 Transitional//EN"
"http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/loose.dtd">

    document.MM_pgW=innerWidth; document.MM_pgH=innerHeight; onresize=MM_reloadPage; }}

<p style="padding-left:5%;padding-right:5%"><b>Warning</b>: This is not a real shop. This is an example PHP application, which is intentionally vulnerable to web attacks. It is intended to help you test Acunetix. It also helps you understand how developer errors and bad configuration may let someone break into your website. You can use it to test other tools and your manual hacking skills as well. Tip: Look for potential SQL Injections, Cross-site Scripting (XSS), and Cross-site Request Forgery (CSRF), and more.</p>

          Evidence 
          X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Solution

          Ensure that your web server, application server, load balancer, etc. is configured to suppress "X-Powered-By" headers.
        11. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/hpp/
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • WSTG-v42-INFO-08
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          The web/application server is leaking information via one or more "X-Powered-By" HTTP response headers. Access to such information may facilitate attackers identifying other frameworks/components your web application is reliant upon and the vulnerabilities such components may be subject to.
          Request
          Request line and header section (247 bytes) 
          GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/hpp/ HTTP/1.1
Host: testphp.vulnweb.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:92.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/92.0
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Referer: http://testphp.vulnweb.com
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (200 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.19.0
Date: Thu, 20 Jan 2022 18:42:49 GMT
Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
Connection: keep-alive
X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Response body (203 bytes) 
          <title>HTTP Parameter Pollution Example</title>

<a href="?pp=12">check</a><br/>

<hr>
<a href='http://blog.mindedsecurity.com/2009/05/client-side-http-parameter-pollution.html'>Original article</a>
          Evidence 
          X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Solution

          Ensure that your web server, application server, load balancer, etc. is configured to suppress "X-Powered-By" headers.
        12. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/hpp/?pp=12
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • WSTG-v42-INFO-08
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          The web/application server is leaking information via one or more "X-Powered-By" HTTP response headers. Access to such information may facilitate attackers identifying other frameworks/components your web application is reliant upon and the vulnerabilities such components may be subject to.
          Request
          Request line and header section (258 bytes) 
          GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/hpp/?pp=12 HTTP/1.1
Host: testphp.vulnweb.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:92.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/92.0
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Referer: http://testphp.vulnweb.com/hpp/
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (200 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.19.0
Date: Thu, 20 Jan 2022 18:42:55 GMT
Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
Connection: keep-alive
X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Response body (383 bytes) 
          <title>HTTP Parameter Pollution Example</title>

<a href="?pp=12">check</a><br/>
<a href="params.php?p=valid&pp=12">link1</a><br/><a href="params.php?p=valid&pp=12">link2</a><br/><form action="params.php?p=valid&pp=12"><input type=submit name=aaaa/></form><br/>
<hr>
<a href='http://blog.mindedsecurity.com/2009/05/client-side-http-parameter-pollution.html'>Original article</a>
          Evidence 
          X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Solution

          Ensure that your web server, application server, load balancer, etc. is configured to suppress "X-Powered-By" headers.
        13. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/hpp/params.php?p=valid&pp=12
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • WSTG-v42-INFO-08
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          The web/application server is leaking information via one or more "X-Powered-By" HTTP response headers. Access to such information may facilitate attackers identifying other frameworks/components your web application is reliant upon and the vulnerabilities such components may be subject to.
          Request
          Request line and header section (282 bytes) 
          GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/hpp/params.php?p=valid&pp=12 HTTP/1.1

Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Referer: http://testphp.vulnweb.com/hpp/?pp=12
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (200 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.19.0
Date: Thu, 20 Jan 2022 18:43:00 GMT
Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
Connection: keep-alive
X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Response body (7 bytes) 
          valid12
          Evidence 
          X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Solution

          Ensure that your web server, application server, load balancer, etc. is configured to suppress "X-Powered-By" headers.
        14. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/index.php

          Evidence 
          X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Solution

          Ensure that your web server, application server, load balancer, etc. is configured to suppress "X-Powered-By" headers.
        15. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/listproducts.php?artist=1
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • WSTG-v42-INFO-08
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          The web/application server is leaking information via one or more "X-Powered-By" HTTP response headers. Access to such information may facilitate attackers identifying other frameworks/components your web application is reliant upon and the vulnerabilities such components may be subject to.
          Request
          Request line and header section (289 bytes) 
          GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/listproducts.php?artist=1 HTTP/1.1
Host: testphp.vulnweb.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:92.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/92.0
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Referer: http://testphp.vulnweb.com/artists.php?artist=1
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (200 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.19.0
Date: Thu, 20 Jan 2022 18:42:59 GMT
Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
Connection: keep-alive
X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Response body (7994 bytes) 
          <!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01 Transitional//EN"
"http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/loose.dtd">
<html><!-- InstanceBegin template="/Templates/main_dynamic_template.dwt.php" codeOutsideHTMLIsLocked="false" -->
<head>
<meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=iso-8859-2">

<p style="padding-left:5%;padding-right:5%"><b>Warning</b>: This is not a real shop. This is an example PHP application, which is intentionally vulnerable to web attacks. It is intended to help you test Acunetix. It also helps you understand how developer errors and bad configuration may let someone break into your website. You can use it to test other tools and your manual hacking skills as well. Tip: Look for potential SQL Injections, Cross-site Scripting (XSS), and Cross-site Request Forgery (CSRF), and more.</p>

<!-- InstanceEnd --></html>
          Evidence 
          X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Solution

          Ensure that your web server, application server, load balancer, etc. is configured to suppress "X-Powered-By" headers.
        16. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/listproducts.php?artist=2
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • WSTG-v42-INFO-08
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Solution

          Ensure that your web server, application server, load balancer, etc. is configured to suppress "X-Powered-By" headers.
        18. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/listproducts.php?cat=1
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • WSTG-v42-INFO-08
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          The web/application server is leaking information via one or more "X-Powered-By" HTTP response headers. Access to such information may facilitate attackers identifying other frameworks/components your web application is reliant upon and the vulnerabilities such components may be subject to.
          Request
          Request line and header section (280 bytes) 
          GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/listproducts.php?cat=1 HTTP/1.1
Host: testphp.vulnweb.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:92.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/92.0
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Referer: http://testphp.vulnweb.com/categories.php
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (200 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.19.0
Date: Thu, 20 Jan 2022 18:42:50 GMT
Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
Connection: keep-alive
X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Response body (7880 bytes) 
          <!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01 Transitional//EN"
"http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/loose.dtd">
<html><!-- InstanceBegin template="/Templates/main_dynamic_template.dwt.php" codeOutsideHTMLIsLocked="false" -->
<head>
<meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=iso-8859-2">

<!-- InstanceBeginEditable name="document_title_rgn" -->
<title>pictures</title>
<!-- InstanceEndEditable -->
<link rel="stylesheet" href="style.css" type="text/css">
<!-- InstanceBeginEditable name="headers_rgn" -->
<!-- InstanceEndEditable -->
<script language="JavaScript" type="text/JavaScript">
<!--

  if (init==true) with (navigator) {if ((appName=="Netscape")&&(parseInt(appVersion)==4)) {
    document.MM_pgW=innerWidth; document.MM_pgH=innerHeight; onresize=MM_reloadPage; }}
  else if (innerWidth!=document.MM_pgW || innerHeight!=document.MM_pgH) location.reload();
}

It is intended to help you test Acunetix. It also helps you understand how developer errors and bad configuration may let someone break into your website. <p style="padding-left:5%;padding-right:5%"><b>Warning</b>: This is not a real shop. This is an example PHP application, which is intentionally vulnerable to web attacks. It is intended to help you test Acunetix. It also helps you understand how developer errors and bad configuration may let someone break into your website. You can use it to test other tools and your manual hacking skills as well. Tip: Look for potential SQL Injections, Cross-site Scripting (XSS), and Cross-site Request Forgery (CSRF), and more.</p>
</div>
</div>
</body>
<!-- InstanceEnd --></html>
          Evidence 
          X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Solution

          Ensure that your web server, application server, load balancer, etc. is configured to suppress "X-Powered-By" headers.
        21. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/listproducts.php?cat=4
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • WSTG-v42-INFO-08
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          The web/application server is leaking information via one or more "X-Powered-By" HTTP response headers. Access to such information may facilitate attackers identifying other frameworks/components your web application is reliant upon and the vulnerabilities such components may be subject to.
          Request
          Request line and header section (280 bytes) 
          GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/listproducts.php?cat=4 HTTP/1.1
Host: testphp.vulnweb.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:92.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/92.0
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Referer: http://testphp.vulnweb.com/categories.php
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (200 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.19.0
Date: Thu, 20 Jan 2022 18:42:51 GMT
Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
Connection: keep-alive
X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Response body (4699 bytes) 
          <!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01 Transitional//EN"
"http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/loose.dtd">

          X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Solution

          Ensure that your web server, application server, load balancer, etc. is configured to suppress "X-Powered-By" headers.

          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01

          Evidence 
          X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Solution

          Ensure that your web server, application server, load balancer, etc. is configured to suppress "X-Powered-By" headers.
        23. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/Mod_Rewrite_Shop/
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • WSTG-v42-INFO-08
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          The web/application server is leaking information via one or more "X-Powered-By" HTTP response headers. Access to such information may facilitate attackers identifying other frameworks/components your web application is reliant upon and the vulnerabilities such components may be subject to.

          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          The web/application server is leaking information via one or more "X-Powered-By" HTTP response headers. Access to such information may facilitate attackers identifying other frameworks/components your web application is reliant upon and the vulnerabilities such components may be subject to.
          Request
          Request line and header section (319 bytes) 
          GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/Mod_Rewrite_Shop/Details/network-attached-storage-dlink/1/ HTTP/1.1
Host: testphp.vulnweb.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:92.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/92.0
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Referer: http://testphp.vulnweb.com/Mod_Rewrite_Shop/
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (200 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.19.0
Date: Thu, 20 Jan 2022 18:42:54 GMT
Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
Connection: keep-alive
X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Response body (319 bytes) 
          <div><img src='/Mod_Rewrite_Shop/images/1.jpg'><b>Network Storage D-Link DNS-313 enclosure 1 x SATA</b><br><br>NET STORAGE ENCLOSURE SATA DNS-313 D-LINK<br><a href='/Mod_Rewrite_Shop/BuyProduct-1/'>Buy</a>&nbsp;<a href='/Mod_Rewrite_Shop/RateProduct-1.html'>Rate</a></div><hr><a href='/Mod_Rewrite_Shop/'>Back</a>
          Evidence 
          X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Solution

          Ensure that your web server, application server, load balancer, etc. is configured to suppress "X-Powered-By" headers.

    <ul>

	  <li><a href="https://www.acunetix.com/vulnerability-scanner/php-security-scanner/">PHP scanner</a></li>
	  <li><a href="https://www.acunetix.com/blog/articles/prevent-sql-injection-vulnerabilities-in-php-applications/">PHP vuln help</a></li>
	  <li><a href="http://www.eclectasy.com/Fractal-Explorer/index.html">Fractal Explorer</a></li> 
    </ul> 
  </div> 
  <div id="advert"> 
    <p>
      <object classid="clsid:D27CDB6E-AE6D-11cf-96B8-444553540000" codebase="http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,29,0" width="107" height="66">
        <param name="movie" value="Flash/add.swf">
        <param name=quality value=high>
        <embed src="Flash/add.swf" quality=high pluginspage="http://www.macromedia.com/shockwave/download/index.cgi?P1_Prod_Version=ShockwaveFlash" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="107" height="66"></embed>
      </object>
    </p>
  </div> 
</div> 

<!--end navbar --> 
<div id="siteInfo">  <a href="http://www.acunetix.com">About Us</a> | <a href="privacy.php">Privacy Policy</a> | <a href="mailto:wvs@acunetix.com">Contact Us</a> | &copy;2019
  Acunetix Ltd 
</div> 
<br> 
<div style="background-color:lightgray;width:100%;text-align:center;font-size:12px;padding:1px">
<p style="padding-left:5%;padding-right:5%"><b>Warning</b>: This is not a real shop. This is an example PHP application, which is intentionally vulnerable to web attacks. It is intended to help you test Acunetix. It also helps you understand how developer errors and bad configuration may let someone break into your website. You can use it to test other tools and your manual hacking skills as well. Tip: Look for potential SQL Injections, Cross-site Scripting (XSS), and Cross-site Request Forgery (CSRF), and more.</p>
</div>
</div>
</body>
<!-- InstanceEnd --></html>
          Evidence 
          X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Solution

          Ensure that your web server, application server, load balancer, etc. is configured to suppress "X-Powered-By" headers.
        36. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/product.php?pic=3
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • WSTG-v42-INFO-08
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          The web/application server is leaking information via one or more "X-Powered-By" HTTP response headers. Access to such information may facilitate attackers identifying other frameworks/components your web application is reliant upon and the vulnerabilities such components may be subject to.
          Request
          Request line and header section (283 bytes) 
          GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/product.php?pic=3 HTTP/1.1
Host: testphp.vulnweb.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:92.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/92.0
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Referer: http://testphp.vulnweb.com/listproducts.php?cat=1
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (200 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.19.0
Date: Thu, 20 Jan 2022 18:42:56 GMT
Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
Connection: keep-alive
X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Response body (6401 bytes) 
          <!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01 Transitional//EN"
"http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/loose.dtd">
<html><!-- InstanceBegin template="/Templates/main_dynamic_template.dwt.php" codeOutsideHTMLIsLocked="false" -->

<!--end content -->

<p style="padding-left:5%;padding-right:5%"><b>Warning</b>: This is not a real shop. This is an example PHP application, which is intentionally vulnerable to web attacks. It is intended to help you test Acunetix. It also helps you understand how developer errors and bad configuration may let someone break into your website. You can use it to test other tools and your manual hacking skills as well. Tip: Look for potential SQL Injections, Cross-site Scripting (XSS), and Cross-site Request Forgery (CSRF), and more.</p>

<!-- InstanceEnd --></html>
          Evidence 
          X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Solution

          Ensure that your web server, application server, load balancer, etc. is configured to suppress "X-Powered-By" headers.
        39. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/product.php?pic=6
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • WSTG-v42-INFO-08
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          The web/application server is leaking information via one or more "X-Powered-By" HTTP response headers. Access to such information may facilitate attackers identifying other frameworks/components your web application is reliant upon and the vulnerabilities such components may be subject to.
          Request
          Request line and header section (283 bytes) 
          GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/product.php?pic=6 HTTP/1.1
Host: testphp.vulnweb.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:92.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/92.0
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Referer: http://testphp.vulnweb.com/listproducts.php?cat=2
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (200 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.19.0
Date: Thu, 20 Jan 2022 18:42:58 GMT
Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
Connection: keep-alive
X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Response body (6454 bytes) 
          <!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01 Transitional//EN"
"http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/loose.dtd">

          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • WSTG-v42-INFO-08
          • OWASP_2017_A03

T7␀␀␀!.(V`fsh)PT?
          Evidence 
          X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Solution

          Ensure that your web server, application server, load balancer, etc. is configured to suppress "X-Powered-By" headers.
        43. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/showimage.php?file=./pictures/1.jpg&size=160
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • WSTG-v42-INFO-08
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          The web/application server is leaking information via one or more "X-Powered-By" HTTP response headers. Access to such information may facilitate attackers identifying other frameworks/components your web application is reliant upon and the vulnerabilities such components may be subject to.
          Request
          Request line and header section (310 bytes) 
          GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/showimage.php?file=./pictures/1.jpg&size=160 HTTP/1.1
Host: testphp.vulnweb.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:92.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/92.0
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Referer: http://testphp.vulnweb.com/listproducts.php?cat=1
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (186 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.19.0
Date: Thu, 20 Jan 2022 18:42:57 GMT
Content-Type: image/jpeg
Connection: keep-alive
X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Response body (12426 bytes) 
          ␀JFIF␀␀␀␀␀␀␀C␀




T7␀␀␀!.(V`fsh)PT?
          Evidence 
          X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Solution

          Ensure that your web server, application server, load balancer, etc. is configured to suppress "X-Powered-By" headers.
        44. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/showimage.php?file=./pictures/2.jpg
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • WSTG-v42-INFO-08
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          The web/application server is leaking information via one or more "X-Powered-By" HTTP response headers. Access to such information may facilitate attackers identifying other frameworks/components your web application is reliant upon and the vulnerabilities such components may be subject to.
          Request
          Request line and header section (301 bytes) 
          GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/showimage.php?file=./pictures/2.jpg HTTP/1.1
Host: testphp.vulnweb.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:92.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/92.0
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Referer: http://testphp.vulnweb.com/listproducts.php?cat=1
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (186 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.19.0
Date: Thu, 20 Jan 2022 18:42:56 GMT
Content-Type: image/jpeg
Connection: keep-alive
X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Response body (3324 bytes) 
          ␀JFIF␀␀␀␀␀␀␀C␀


          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • WSTG-v42-INFO-08
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          The web/application server is leaking information via one or more "X-Powered-By" HTTP response headers. Access to such information may facilitate attackers identifying other frameworks/components your web application is reliant upon and the vulnerabilities such components may be subject to.
          Request
          Request line and header section (310 bytes) 
          GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/showimage.php?file=./pictures/2.jpg&size=160 HTTP/1.1
Host: testphp.vulnweb.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:92.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/92.0
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Referer: http://testphp.vulnweb.com/listproducts.php?cat=1
          Request body (0 bytes)

          Evidence 
          X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Solution

          Ensure that your web server, application server, load balancer, etc. is configured to suppress "X-Powered-By" headers.
        46. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/showimage.php?file=./pictures/3.jpg

!ZS@whCNl	"@w3iR`x?
          Evidence 
          X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Solution

          Ensure that your web server, application server, load balancer, etc. is configured to suppress "X-Powered-By" headers.
        47. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/showimage.php?file=./pictures/3.jpg&size=160
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • WSTG-v42-INFO-08
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          The web/application server is leaking information via one or more "X-Powered-By" HTTP response headers. Access to such information may facilitate attackers identifying other frameworks/components your web application is reliant upon and the vulnerabilities such components may be subject to.
          Request
          Request line and header section (310 bytes) 
          GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/showimage.php?file=./pictures/3.jpg&size=160 HTTP/1.1
Host: testphp.vulnweb.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:92.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/92.0
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Referer: http://testphp.vulnweb.com/listproducts.php?cat=1
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (186 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.19.0
Date: Thu, 20 Jan 2022 18:42:58 GMT
Content-Type: image/jpeg
Connection: keep-alive
X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1

[NFq(w,D?yN6'#U$tT_<l8(	<nWR2\?Xu4"IKp Bhn<?Si␀>5gQr~?
          Evidence 
          X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Solution

          Ensure that your web server, application server, load balancer, etc. is configured to suppress "X-Powered-By" headers.
        49. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/showimage.php?file=./pictures/4.jpg&size=160
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • WSTG-v42-INFO-08
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          The web/application server is leaking information via one or more "X-Powered-By" HTTP response headers. Access to such information may facilitate attackers identifying other frameworks/components your web application is reliant upon and the vulnerabilities such components may be subject to.
          Request
          Request line and header section (310 bytes) 
          GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/showimage.php?file=./pictures/4.jpg&size=160 HTTP/1.1
Host: testphp.vulnweb.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:92.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/92.0
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Referer: http://testphp.vulnweb.com/listproducts.php?cat=1
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (186 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.19.0
Date: Thu, 20 Jan 2022 18:42:58 GMT
Content-Type: image/jpeg
Connection: keep-alive
X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Response body (13969 bytes) 
          ␀JFIF␀␀␀␀␀␀␀C␀


[NFq(w,D?yN6'#U$tT_<l8(	<nWR2\?Xu4"IKp Bhn<?Si␀>5gQr~?
          Evidence 
          X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Solution

          Ensure that your web server, application server, load balancer, etc. is configured to suppress "X-Powered-By" headers.
        50. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/showimage.php?file=./pictures/5.jpg
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • WSTG-v42-INFO-08
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          The web/application server is leaking information via one or more "X-Powered-By" HTTP response headers. Access to such information may facilitate attackers identifying other frameworks/components your web application is reliant upon and the vulnerabilities such components may be subject to.
          Request
          Request line and header section (301 bytes) 
          GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/showimage.php?file=./pictures/5.jpg HTTP/1.1
Host: testphp.vulnweb.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:92.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/92.0
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Referer: http://testphp.vulnweb.com/listproducts.php?cat=1
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (186 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.19.0
Date: Thu, 20 Jan 2022 18:42:57 GMT
Content-Type: image/jpeg
Connection: keep-alive
X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Response body (14228 bytes) 
          ␀JFIF␀␀␀␀␀␀␀C␀


?5<QM;SO<oUOfd␀[011]){q~r?S Q)8`$7/8<<p8u0RnI@<␀AOXUJerr+)\\X+~+S.Wi#>YY_r␀
          Evidence 
          X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Solution

          Ensure that your web server, application server, load balancer, etc. is configured to suppress "X-Powered-By" headers.
        51. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/showimage.php?file=./pictures/5.jpg&size=160
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • WSTG-v42-INFO-08
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          The web/application server is leaking information via one or more "X-Powered-By" HTTP response headers. Access to such information may facilitate attackers identifying other frameworks/components your web application is reliant upon and the vulnerabilities such components may be subject to.
          Request
          Request line and header section (310 bytes) 
          GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/showimage.php?file=./pictures/5.jpg&size=160 HTTP/1.1
Host: testphp.vulnweb.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:92.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/92.0
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Referer: http://testphp.vulnweb.com/listproducts.php?cat=1
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (186 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.19.0
Date: Thu, 20 Jan 2022 18:42:58 GMT
Content-Type: image/jpeg
Connection: keep-alive
X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Response body (14228 bytes) 
          ␀JFIF␀␀␀␀␀␀␀C␀


?5<QM;SO<oUOfd␀[011]){q~r?S Q)8`$7/8<<p8u0RnI@<␀AOXUJerr+)\\X+~+S.Wi#>YY_r␀
          Evidence 
          X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Solution

          Ensure that your web server, application server, load balancer, etc. is configured to suppress "X-Powered-By" headers.
        52. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/showimage.php?file=./pictures/6.jpg
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • WSTG-v42-INFO-08
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          The web/application server is leaking information via one or more "X-Powered-By" HTTP response headers. Access to such information may facilitate attackers identifying other frameworks/components your web application is reliant upon and the vulnerabilities such components may be subject to.
          Request
          Request line and header section (301 bytes) 
          GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/showimage.php?file=./pictures/6.jpg HTTP/1.1
Host: testphp.vulnweb.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:92.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/92.0
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Referer: http://testphp.vulnweb.com/listproducts.php?cat=2
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (186 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.19.0
Date: Thu, 20 Jan 2022 18:42:58 GMT
Content-Type: image/jpeg
Connection: keep-alive
X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Response body (11465 bytes) 
          ␀JFIF␀␀␀␀␀␀␀C␀




 (do0	3I;Ou		_FK'-^8+␀IrPk>␀b l Y_␀
          Evidence 
          X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Solution

          Ensure that your web server, application server, load balancer, etc. is configured to suppress "X-Powered-By" headers.
        53. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/showimage.php?file=./pictures/6.jpg&size=160
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • WSTG-v42-INFO-08
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          The web/application server is leaking information via one or more "X-Powered-By" HTTP response headers. Access to such information may facilitate attackers identifying other frameworks/components your web application is reliant upon and the vulnerabilities such components may be subject to.
          Request
          Request line and header section (310 bytes) 
          GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/showimage.php?file=./pictures/6.jpg&size=160 HTTP/1.1
Host: testphp.vulnweb.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:92.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/92.0
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Referer: http://testphp.vulnweb.com/listproducts.php?cat=2
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (186 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.19.0
Date: Thu, 20 Jan 2022 18:42:59 GMT
Content-Type: image/jpeg
Connection: keep-alive
X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Response body (11465 bytes) 
          ␀JFIF␀␀␀␀␀␀␀C␀

 (do0	3I;Ou		_FK'-^8+␀IrPk>␀b l Y_␀
          Evidence 
          X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Solution

          Ensure that your web server, application server, load balancer, etc. is configured to suppress "X-Powered-By" headers.
        54. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/showimage.php?file=./pictures/7.jpg
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • WSTG-v42-INFO-08
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          The web/application server is leaking information via one or more "X-Powered-By" HTTP response headers. Access to such information may facilitate attackers identifying other frameworks/components your web application is reliant upon and the vulnerabilities such components may be subject to.
          Request
          Request line and header section (301 bytes) 
          GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/showimage.php?file=./pictures/7.jpg HTTP/1.1
Host: testphp.vulnweb.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:92.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/92.0
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Referer: http://testphp.vulnweb.com/listproducts.php?cat=1
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (186 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.19.0
Date: Thu, 20 Jan 2022 18:42:57 GMT
Content-Type: image/jpeg
Connection: keep-alive
X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Response body (19219 bytes) 
          ␀JFIF␀␀␀␀␀␀␀C␀

]_%"_aGhB1GO?
          Evidence 
          X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Solution

          Ensure that your web server, application server, load balancer, etc. is configured to suppress "X-Powered-By" headers.
        55. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/showimage.php?file=./pictures/7.jpg&size=160
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • WSTG-v42-INFO-08
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          The web/application server is leaking information via one or more "X-Powered-By" HTTP response headers. Access to such information may facilitate attackers identifying other frameworks/components your web application is reliant upon and the vulnerabilities such components may be subject to.
          Request
          Request line and header section (310 bytes) 
          GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/showimage.php?file=./pictures/7.jpg&size=160 HTTP/1.1
Host: testphp.vulnweb.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:92.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/92.0
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Referer: http://testphp.vulnweb.com/listproducts.php?cat=1
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (186 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.19.0
Date: Thu, 20 Jan 2022 18:42:58 GMT
Content-Type: image/jpeg
Connection: keep-alive
X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Response body (19219 bytes) 
          ␀JFIF␀␀␀␀␀␀␀C␀

]_%"_aGhB1GO?
          Evidence 
          X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Solution

          Ensure that your web server, application server, load balancer, etc. is configured to suppress "X-Powered-By" headers.
        56. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/signup.php
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • WSTG-v42-INFO-08
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          The web/application server is leaking information via one or more "X-Powered-By" HTTP response headers. Access to such information may facilitate attackers identifying other frameworks/components your web application is reliant upon and the vulnerabilities such components may be subject to.
          Request
          Request line and header section (263 bytes) 
          GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/signup.php HTTP/1.1
Host: testphp.vulnweb.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:92.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/92.0
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Referer: http://testphp.vulnweb.com/login.php
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (200 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.19.0
Date: Thu, 20 Jan 2022 18:42:53 GMT
Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8

<div class="story">
	<h2 id="pageName">Signup new user</h2>
	<h4>Please do not enter real information here.</h4>
	<h4>If you press the submit button you will be transferred to asecured connection.</h4>
	<form name="form1" method="post" action="/secured/newuser.php">
		<table border="0" cellspacing="1" cellpadding="4">
			<tr><td valign="top">Username:</td><td><input type="text" name="uuname" style="width:200px"></td></tr>
			<tr><td valign="top">Password:</td><td><input type="password" name="upass" style="width:200px"></td></tr>
			<tr><td valign="top">Retype password:</td><td><input type="password" name="upass2" style="width:200px"></td></tr>
			<tr><td valign="top">Name:</td><td><input type="text" name="urname" style="width:200px"></td></tr>
			<tr><td valign="top">Credit card number:</td><td><input type="text" name="ucc" style="width:200px"></td></tr>
			<tr><td valign="top">E-Mail:</td><td><input type="text" name="uemail" style="width:200px"></td></tr>
			<tr><td valign="top">Phone number:</td><td><input type="text" name="uphone" style="width:200px"></td></tr>
			<tr><td valign="top">Address:</td><td><textarea wrap="soft" name="uaddress" rows="5" style="width:200px"></textarea></td></tr>
			<tr><td colspan="2" align="right"><input type="submit" value="signup" name="signup"></td></tr>
		</table>
	</form>
</div>

<div style="background-color:lightgray;width:100%;text-align:center;font-size:12px;padding:1px">
<p style="padding-left:5%;padding-right:5%"><b>Warning</b>: This is not a real shop. This is an example PHP application, which is intentionally vulnerable to web attacks. It is intended to help you test Acunetix. It also helps you understand how developer errors and bad configuration may let someone break into your website. You can use it to test other tools and your manual hacking skills as well. Tip: Look for potential SQL Injections, Cross-site Scripting (XSS), and Cross-site Request Forgery (CSRF), and more.</p>
</div>

<!-- InstanceEnd --></html>
          Evidence 
          X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Solution

          Ensure that your web server, application server, load balancer, etc. is configured to suppress "X-Powered-By" headers.
        57. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/userinfo.php
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • WSTG-v42-INFO-08
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          The web/application server is leaking information via one or more "X-Powered-By" HTTP response headers. Access to such information may facilitate attackers identifying other frameworks/components your web application is reliant upon and the vulnerabilities such components may be subject to.
          Request
          Request line and header section (255 bytes) 
          GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/userinfo.php HTTP/1.1
Host: testphp.vulnweb.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:92.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/92.0
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Referer: http://testphp.vulnweb.com
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (224 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.1 302 Found
Server: nginx/1.19.0
Date: Thu, 20 Jan 2022 18:42:48 GMT
Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
Connection: keep-alive
X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
Location: login.php
          Response body (14 bytes) 
          you must login
          Evidence 
          X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Solution

          Ensure that your web server, application server, load balancer, etc. is configured to suppress "X-Powered-By" headers.
        58. POST http://testphp.vulnweb.com/cart.php
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • WSTG-v42-INFO-08
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          The web/application server is leaking information via one or more "X-Powered-By" HTTP response headers. Access to such information may facilitate attackers identifying other frameworks/components your web application is reliant upon and the vulnerabilities such components may be subject to.
          Request
          Request line and header section (339 bytes) 
          POST http://testphp.vulnweb.com/cart.php HTTP/1.1
Host: testphp.vulnweb.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:92.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/92.0
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
Referer: http://testphp.vulnweb.com/product.php?pic=2
Content-Length: 19
          Request body (19 bytes) 
          price=800&addcart=2
          Response
          Status line and header section (200 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.19.0
Date: Thu, 20 Jan 2022 18:43:01 GMT
Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
Connection: keep-alive
X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Response body (4903 bytes) 
          <!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01 Transitional//EN"

          X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1

          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01

          HTTP/1.1 200 OK

<div style="background-color:lightgray;width:100%;text-align:center;font-size:12px;padding:1px">
<p style="padding-left:5%;padding-right:5%"><b>Warning</b>: This is not a real shop. This is an example PHP application, which is intentionally vulnerable to web attacks. It is intended to help you test Acunetix. It also helps you understand how developer errors and bad configuration may let someone break into your website. You can use it to test other tools and your manual hacking skills as well. Tip: Look for potential SQL Injections, Cross-site Scripting (XSS), and Cross-site Request Forgery (CSRF), and more.</p>

<!-- InstanceEnd --></html>
          Evidence 
          X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Solution

          Ensure that your web server, application server, load balancer, etc. is configured to suppress "X-Powered-By" headers.
        61. POST http://testphp.vulnweb.com/secured/newuser.php
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • WSTG-v42-INFO-08
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          The web/application server is leaking information via one or more "X-Powered-By" HTTP response headers. Access to such information may facilitate attackers identifying other frameworks/components your web application is reliant upon and the vulnerabilities such components may be subject to.
          Request
          Request line and header section (343 bytes) 
          POST http://testphp.vulnweb.com/secured/newuser.php HTTP/1.1
Host: testphp.vulnweb.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:92.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/92.0
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
Referer: http://testphp.vulnweb.com/signup.php
Content-Length: 96
          Request body (96 bytes) 
          uuname=ZAP&upass=ZAP&upass2=ZAP&urname=ZAP&ucc=ZAP&uemail=ZAP&uphone=ZAP&uaddress=&signup=signup
          Response
          Status line and header section (200 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.19.0
Date: Thu, 20 Jan 2022 18:42:59 GMT
Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
Connection: keep-alive
X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Response body (733 bytes) 
          <!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01 Transitional//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/loose.dtd">
<html>
<head>
<title>add new user</title>
<meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
<link href="style.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css">
</head>

  <h1 id="siteName">ACUNETIX ART</h1>

          Evidence 
          X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Solution

          Ensure that your web server, application server, load balancer, etc. is configured to suppress "X-Powered-By" headers.
        62. POST http://testphp.vulnweb.com/userinfo.php
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A01
          • WSTG-v42-INFO-08
          • OWASP_2017_A03
          Alert description

          The web/application server is leaking information via one or more "X-Powered-By" HTTP response headers. Access to such information may facilitate attackers identifying other frameworks/components your web application is reliant upon and the vulnerabilities such components may be subject to.
          Request
          Request line and header section (335 bytes) 
          POST http://testphp.vulnweb.com/userinfo.php HTTP/1.1
Host: testphp.vulnweb.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:92.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/92.0
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
Referer: http://testphp.vulnweb.com/login.php
Content-Length: 18
          Request body (18 bytes) 
          uname=ZAP&pass=ZAP
          Response
          Status line and header section (224 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.1 302 Found
Server: nginx/1.19.0
Date: Thu, 20 Jan 2022 18:42:54 GMT
Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
Connection: keep-alive
X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
Location: login.php
          Response body (14 bytes) 
          you must login
          Evidence 
          X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Solution

          Ensure that your web server, application server, load balancer, etc. is configured to suppress "X-Powered-By" headers.
      3. X-Content-Type-Options Header Missing (67)
        1. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A05
          • OWASP_2017_A06
          Alert description

          The Anti-MIME-Sniffing header X-Content-Type-Options was not set to 'nosniff'. This allows older versions of Internet Explorer and Chrome to perform MIME-sniffing on the response body, potentially causing the response body to be interpreted and displayed as a content type other than the declared content type. Current (early 2014) and legacy versions of Firefox will use the declared content type (if one is set), rather than performing MIME-sniffing.
          Other info

          This issue still applies to error type pages (401, 403, 500, etc.) as those pages are often still affected by injection issues, in which case there is still concern for browsers sniffing pages away from their actual content type.

          At "High" threshold this scan rule will not alert on client or server error responses.
          Request
          Request line and header section (205 bytes) 
          GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com HTTP/1.1
Host: testphp.vulnweb.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:92.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/92.0
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (200 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.19.0
Date: Thu, 20 Jan 2022 18:42:45 GMT
Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
Connection: keep-alive
X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Response body (4958 bytes) 
          <!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01 Transitional//EN"
"http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/loose.dtd">
<html><!-- InstanceBegin template="/Templates/main_dynamic_template.dwt.php" codeOutsideHTMLIsLocked="false" -->

<div style="background-color:lightgray;width:100%;text-align:center;font-size:12px;padding:1px">
<p style="padding-left:5%;padding-right:5%"><b>Warning</b>: This is not a real shop. This is an example PHP application, which is intentionally vulnerable to web attacks. It is intended to help you test Acunetix. It also helps you understand how developer errors and bad configuration may let someone break into your website. You can use it to test other tools and your manual hacking skills as well. Tip: Look for potential SQL Injections, Cross-site Scripting (XSS), and Cross-site Request Forgery (CSRF), and more.</p>

<!-- InstanceEnd --></html>
          Parameter 
          X-Content-Type-Options
          Solution

          Ensure that the application/web server sets the Content-Type header appropriately, and that it sets the X-Content-Type-Options header to 'nosniff' for all web pages.

          If possible, ensure that the end user uses a standards-compliant and modern web browser that does not perform MIME-sniffing at all, or that can be directed by the web application/web server to not perform MIME-sniffing.
        2. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/AJAX/index.php
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A05
          • OWASP_2017_A06
          Alert description

          The Anti-MIME-Sniffing header X-Content-Type-Options was not set to 'nosniff'. This allows older versions of Internet Explorer and Chrome to perform MIME-sniffing on the response body, potentially causing the response body to be interpreted and displayed as a content type other than the declared content type. Current (early 2014) and legacy versions of Firefox will use the declared content type (if one is set), rather than performing MIME-sniffing.
          Other info

          This issue still applies to error type pages (401, 403, 500, etc.) as those pages are often still affected by injection issues, in which case there is still concern for browsers sniffing pages away from their actual content type.

          At "High" threshold this scan rule will not alert on client or server error responses.
          Request
          Request line and header section (257 bytes) 
          GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/AJAX/index.php HTTP/1.1
Host: testphp.vulnweb.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:92.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/92.0
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Referer: http://testphp.vulnweb.com
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (200 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.19.0
Date: Thu, 20 Jan 2022 18:42:48 GMT
Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
Connection: keep-alive
X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Response body (4236 bytes) 
          <!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Transitional//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">
<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">
<head>
<meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1" />
<title>ajax test</title>
<link href="styles.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" />
<script type="text/javascript">
	var httpreq = null;	

	function SetContent(XML) {
		var items = XML.getElementsByTagName('items').item(0).getElementsByTagName('item');
		var inner = '<ul>';
		for(i=0; i<items.length; i++){
			inner = inner + '<li><a href="javascript:getInfo(\'' + items[i].attributes.item(0).value + '\', \'' + items[i].attributes.item(1).value + '\')">' + items[i].firstChild.nodeValue + '</a></li>';
		}
		
		inner = inner + '</ul>'
		
		cd = document.getElementById('contentDiv');
		cd.innerHTML = inner;
		
		id = document.getElementById('infoDiv');
		id.innerHTML = '';
	}

	function httpCompleted() {
		if (httpreq.readyState==4 && httpreq.status==200) {						
			SetContent(httpreq.responseXML);
			httpreq = null;
		}		
	}
	
	function SetInfo(XML) {
		var ii = XML.getElementsByTagName('iteminfo').item(0);
		var inner = '';
		
		inner = inner + '<p><strong>' + ii.getElementsByTagName('name').item(0).firstChild.nodeValue + '</strong></p>';
		
		pict  = ii.getElementsByTagName('picture');
		if(pict.length>0){
			inner = inner + '<img src="../showimage.php?file=' + pict.item(0).firstChild.nodeValue + '"/>';
		}
		
		descs = ii.getElementsByTagName('description');
		for (i=0; i<descs.length; i++){
			inner = inner + '<p>' + descs.item(i).firstChild.nodeValue + '</p>';
		}
		
		id = document.getElementById('infoDiv');
		id.innerHTML = inner;
	}
	
	function httpInfoCompleted() {		
		if (httpreq.readyState==4 && httpreq.status==200) {
			SetInfo(httpreq.responseXML);
			httpreq = null;
		}		
	}
	
	function loadSomething(what) {			
		getHttpRequest();		
		httpreq.open('GET', what, true);		
		httpreq.send('');
	}
	
	function getInfo(where, which) {
		getHttpRequest();		
		httpreq.onreadystatechange = httpInfoCompleted;
		if (where=='infotitle'){
			httpreq.open('POST', where+'.php', true);
			httpreq.setRequestHeader('content-type', 'application/x-www-form-urlencoded');
			httpreq.send('id='+which);
		}
		else {
			httpreq.open('GET', where+'.php?id='+which, true);
			httpreq.send('');
		}
	}
	
	function xmlCompleted () {
		if (httpreq.readyState==4 && httpreq.status==200) {
			xd = document.getElementById('xmlDiv');
			xd.innerHTML = httpreq.responseText;
			httpreq = null;
		}	
	}
	
	function sendXML () {
		getHttpRequest();
		httpreq.onreadystatechange = xmlCompleted;
		httpreq.open('POST', 'showxml.php');
		httpreq.setRequestHeader('content-type', 'text/xml');
		httpreq.send('<xml><node name="nodename1">nodetext1</node><node name="nodename2">nodetext2</node></xml>');
	}
	
	function getHttpRequest() {
		// free the curent one
		if (httpreq!=null){
			httpreq.abort();
			httpreq = null;
		}		

    if( window.XMLHttpRequest ) {
			httpreq = new XMLHttpRequest();
			if (httpreq.overrideMimeType) {
					httpreq.overrideMimeType('text/xml');
			}
    } else if(ActiveXObject) {
     	httpreq = new ActiveXObject("Msxml2.XMLHTTP");
		}
			httpreq.onreadystatechange = httpCompleted;
	}
	
	function SetMyCookie() {
		document.cookie = "mycookie=3";
		alert('A cookie was set by JavaScript.');
	}
</script>
</head>
<body>
<table border="0" cellpadding="3" width="500" align="center">
  <tr>
    <td class="bordered">
			<a href="javascript:loadSomething('artists.php');">artists</a> |
			<a href="javascript:loadSomething('categories.php');">categories</a> | 
			<a href="#" onclick="loadSomething('titles.php')">titles</a> |
			<a href="#" onclick="sendXML()">send xml</a> |
			<a href="#" onclick="SetMyCookie()">setcookie</a>
		</td>
  </tr>
  <tr>
    <td>
			<div id="contentDiv">
				&nbsp;
			</div>
		</td>
  </tr>
	<tr>
    <td>
			<div id="infoDiv">
				&nbsp;
			</div>
		</td>
  </tr>
	
	<tr>
    <td>
			<div id="xmlDiv">
				&nbsp;
			</div>
		</td>
  </tr>
</table>
</body>
</html>
          Parameter 
          X-Content-Type-Options
          Solution

          Ensure that the application/web server sets the Content-Type header appropriately, and that it sets the X-Content-Type-Options header to 'nosniff' for all web pages.

          If possible, ensure that the end user uses a standards-compliant and modern web browser that does not perform MIME-sniffing at all, or that can be directed by the web application/web server to not perform MIME-sniffing.
        3. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/AJAX/styles.css
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A05
          • OWASP_2017_A06
          Alert description

          The Anti-MIME-Sniffing header X-Content-Type-Options was not set to 'nosniff'. This allows older versions of Internet Explorer and Chrome to perform MIME-sniffing on the response body, potentially causing the response body to be interpreted and displayed as a content type other than the declared content type. Current (early 2014) and legacy versions of Firefox will use the declared content type (if one is set), rather than performing MIME-sniffing.
          Other info

          This issue still applies to error type pages (401, 403, 500, etc.) as those pages are often still affected by injection issues, in which case there is still concern for browsers sniffing pages away from their actual content type.

          At "High" threshold this scan rule will not alert on client or server error responses.
          Request
          Request line and header section (273 bytes) 
          GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/AJAX/styles.css HTTP/1.1
Host: testphp.vulnweb.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:92.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/92.0
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Referer: http://testphp.vulnweb.com/AJAX/index.php
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (237 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.19.0
Date: Thu, 20 Jan 2022 18:42:52 GMT
Content-Type: text/css
Content-Length: 562
Last-Modified: Wed, 11 May 2011 10:27:48 GMT
Connection: keep-alive
ETag: "4dca64a4-232"
Accept-Ranges: bytes
          Response body (562 bytes) 
          body {
  font-family: Verdana, Geneva, Arial, helvetica, sans-serif;
}

td {
	font-family: Verdana, Geneva, Arial, helvetica, sans-serif;
}

th {
	font-family: Verdana, Geneva, Arial, helvetica, sans-serif;
}

a {
	text-decoration: none;
	color:#333333;
}

a:hover {
	background-color: #FFEE00;
}

td.bordered {
	border: 1px solid #CCCCCC;
	background:#FFCC00;
}

#contentDiv {
	border: 1px solid #CCCCCC;
}

#xmlDiv {
	font-family: "Courier New", Courier, mono;
	font-size: 12px;
	color: #33CC00;
	background-color: #000000;
}
          Parameter 
          X-Content-Type-Options
          Solution

          Ensure that the application/web server sets the Content-Type header appropriately, and that it sets the X-Content-Type-Options header to 'nosniff' for all web pages.

          If possible, ensure that the end user uses a standards-compliant and modern web browser that does not perform MIME-sniffing at all, or that can be directed by the web application/web server to not perform MIME-sniffing.
        4. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/artists.php
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A05
          • OWASP_2017_A06
          Alert description

          The Anti-MIME-Sniffing header X-Content-Type-Options was not set to 'nosniff'. This allows older versions of Internet Explorer and Chrome to perform MIME-sniffing on the response body, potentially causing the response body to be interpreted and displayed as a content type other than the declared content type. Current (early 2014) and legacy versions of Firefox will use the declared content type (if one is set), rather than performing MIME-sniffing.
          Other info

          This issue still applies to error type pages (401, 403, 500, etc.) as those pages are often still affected by injection issues, in which case there is still concern for browsers sniffing pages away from their actual content type.

          At "High" threshold this scan rule will not alert on client or server error responses.

          GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/artists.php HTTP/1.1
Host: testphp.vulnweb.com

          Parameter 
          X-Content-Type-Options
          Solution

          Ensure that the application/web server sets the Content-Type header appropriately, and that it sets the X-Content-Type-Options header to 'nosniff' for all web pages.

          If possible, ensure that the end user uses a standards-compliant and modern web browser that does not perform MIME-sniffing at all, or that can be directed by the web application/web server to not perform MIME-sniffing.
        5. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/artists.php?artist=1
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A05
          • OWASP_2017_A06
          Alert description

          The Anti-MIME-Sniffing header X-Content-Type-Options was not set to 'nosniff'. This allows older versions of Internet Explorer and Chrome to perform MIME-sniffing on the response body, potentially causing the response body to be interpreted and displayed as a content type other than the declared content type. Current (early 2014) and legacy versions of Firefox will use the declared content type (if one is set), rather than performing MIME-sniffing.
          Other info

          This issue still applies to error type pages (401, 403, 500, etc.) as those pages are often still affected by injection issues, in which case there is still concern for browsers sniffing pages away from their actual content type.

          At "High" threshold this scan rule will not alert on client or server error responses.

    Sed aliquam sem ut arcu. Phasellus sollicitudin. Vestibulum condimentum facilisis
    nulla. In hac habitasse platea dictumst. Nulla nonummy. Cras quis libero.

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetuer adipiscing elit. Donec molestie.
Sed aliquam sem ut arcu. Phasellus sollicitudin. Vestibulum condimentum facilisis
nulla. In hac habitasse platea dictumst. Nulla nonummy. Cras quis libero.

mauris vulputate lacinia. Aenean viverra. Class aptent taciti sociosqu ad
litora torquent per conubia nostra, per inceptos hymenaeos. Aliquam lacus.

</p>
<p>
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetuer adipiscing elit. Donec molestie.
Sed aliquam sem ut arcu. Phasellus sollicitudin. Vestibulum condimentum facilisis
nulla. In hac habitasse platea dictumst. Nulla nonummy. Cras quis libero.
Cras venenatis. Aliquam posuere lobortis pede. Nullam fringilla urna id leo.
Praesent aliquet pretium erat. Praesent non odio. Pellentesque a magna a
mauris vulputate lacinia. Aenean viverra. Class aptent taciti sociosqu ad
litora torquent per conubia nostra, per inceptos hymenaeos. Aliquam lacus.
Mauris magna eros, semper a, tempor et, rutrum et, tortor.
</p></p><p><a href='listproducts.php?artist=2'>view pictures of the artist</a></p><p><a href='#' onClick="window.open('./comment.php?aid=2','comment','width=500,height=400')">comment on this artist</a></p></div>	
</div>
<!-- InstanceEndEditable -->
<!--end content -->

<div style="background-color:lightgray;width:100%;text-align:center;font-size:12px;padding:1px">
<p style="padding-left:5%;padding-right:5%"><b>Warning</b>: This is not a real shop. This is an example PHP application, which is intentionally vulnerable to web attacks. It is intended to help you test Acunetix. It also helps you understand how developer errors and bad configuration may let someone break into your website. You can use it to test other tools and your manual hacking skills as well. Tip: Look for potential SQL Injections, Cross-site Scripting (XSS), and Cross-site Request Forgery (CSRF), and more.</p>
</div>
</div>
</body>
<!-- InstanceEnd --></html>
          Parameter 
          X-Content-Type-Options
          Solution

          Ensure that the application/web server sets the Content-Type header appropriately, and that it sets the X-Content-Type-Options header to 'nosniff' for all web pages.

          If possible, ensure that the end user uses a standards-compliant and modern web browser that does not perform MIME-sniffing at all, or that can be directed by the web application/web server to not perform MIME-sniffing.
        7. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/artists.php?artist=3
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A05
          • OWASP_2017_A06
          Alert description

          The Anti-MIME-Sniffing header X-Content-Type-Options was not set to 'nosniff'. This allows older versions of Internet Explorer and Chrome to perform MIME-sniffing on the response body, potentially causing the response body to be interpreted and displayed as a content type other than the declared content type. Current (early 2014) and legacy versions of Firefox will use the declared content type (if one is set), rather than performing MIME-sniffing.
          Other info

          This issue still applies to error type pages (401, 403, 500, etc.) as those pages are often still affected by injection issues, in which case there is still concern for browsers sniffing pages away from their actual content type.

          At "High" threshold this scan rule will not alert on client or server error responses.
          Request
          Request line and header section (275 bytes) 
          GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/artists.php?artist=3 HTTP/1.1
Host: testphp.vulnweb.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:92.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/92.0
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Referer: http://testphp.vulnweb.com/artists.php
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (200 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.19.0
Date: Thu, 20 Jan 2022 18:42:52 GMT
Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
Connection: keep-alive
X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Response body (6193 bytes) 
          <!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01 Transitional//EN"
"http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/loose.dtd">
<html><!-- InstanceBegin template="/Templates/main_dynamic_template.dwt.php" codeOutsideHTMLIsLocked="false" -->
<head>
<meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=iso-8859-2">

<!-- InstanceBeginEditable name="document_title_rgn" -->
<title>artists</title>
<!-- InstanceEndEditable -->
<link rel="stylesheet" href="style.css" type="text/css">
<!-- InstanceBeginEditable name="headers_rgn" -->
<!-- here goes headers headers -->
<!-- InstanceEndEditable -->
<script language="JavaScript" type="text/JavaScript">
<!--
function MM_reloadPage(init) {  //reloads the window if Nav4 resized
  if (init==true) with (navigator) {if ((appName=="Netscape")&&(parseInt(appVersion)==4)) {
    document.MM_pgW=innerWidth; document.MM_pgH=innerHeight; onresize=MM_reloadPage; }}
  else if (innerWidth!=document.MM_pgW || innerHeight!=document.MM_pgH) location.reload();
}
MM_reloadPage(true);
//-->
</script>

</head>
<body>

<div id="content">
	<h2 id='pageName'>artist: lyzae</h2><div class='story'><p><p>
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetuer adipiscing elit. Donec molestie.
Sed aliquam sem ut arcu. Phasellus sollicitudin. Vestibulum condimentum facilisis
nulla. In hac habitasse platea dictumst. Nulla nonummy. Cras quis libero.
Cras venenatis. Aliquam posuere lobortis pede. Nullam fringilla urna id leo.

mauris vulputate lacinia. Aenean viverra. Class aptent taciti sociosqu ad
litora torquent per conubia nostra, per inceptos hymenaeos. Aliquam lacus.
Mauris magna eros, semper a, tempor et, rutrum et, tortor.
</p>

          Parameter 
          X-Content-Type-Options
          Solution

          Ensure that the application/web server sets the Content-Type header appropriately, and that it sets the X-Content-Type-Options header to 'nosniff' for all web pages.

          If possible, ensure that the end user uses a standards-compliant and modern web browser that does not perform MIME-sniffing at all, or that can be directed by the web application/web server to not perform MIME-sniffing.
        8. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/cart.php
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A05
          • OWASP_2017_A06
          Alert description

          The Anti-MIME-Sniffing header X-Content-Type-Options was not set to 'nosniff'. This allows older versions of Internet Explorer and Chrome to perform MIME-sniffing on the response body, potentially causing the response body to be interpreted and displayed as a content type other than the declared content type. Current (early 2014) and legacy versions of Firefox will use the declared content type (if one is set), rather than performing MIME-sniffing.
          Other info

          This issue still applies to error type pages (401, 403, 500, etc.) as those pages are often still affected by injection issues, in which case there is still concern for browsers sniffing pages away from their actual content type.

          At "High" threshold this scan rule will not alert on client or server error responses.

          Parameter 
          X-Content-Type-Options
          Solution

          Ensure that the application/web server sets the Content-Type header appropriately, and that it sets the X-Content-Type-Options header to 'nosniff' for all web pages.

          If possible, ensure that the end user uses a standards-compliant and modern web browser that does not perform MIME-sniffing at all, or that can be directed by the web application/web server to not perform MIME-sniffing.
        9. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/categories.php
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A05
          • OWASP_2017_A06
          Alert description

          The Anti-MIME-Sniffing header X-Content-Type-Options was not set to 'nosniff'. This allows older versions of Internet Explorer and Chrome to perform MIME-sniffing on the response body, potentially causing the response body to be interpreted and displayed as a content type other than the declared content type. Current (early 2014) and legacy versions of Firefox will use the declared content type (if one is set), rather than performing MIME-sniffing.

          This issue still applies to error type pages (401, 403, 500, etc.) as those pages are often still affected by injection issues, in which case there is still concern for browsers sniffing pages away from their actual content type.

<div style="background-color:lightgray;width:100%;text-align:center;font-size:12px;padding:1px">
<p style="padding-left:5%;padding-right:5%"><b>Warning</b>: This is not a real shop. This is an example PHP application, which is intentionally vulnerable to web attacks. It is intended to help you test Acunetix. It also helps you understand how developer errors and bad configuration may let someone break into your website. You can use it to test other tools and your manual hacking skills as well. Tip: Look for potential SQL Injections, Cross-site Scripting (XSS), and Cross-site Request Forgery (CSRF), and more.</p>
</div>

<!-- InstanceEnd --></html>
          Parameter 
          X-Content-Type-Options
          Solution

          Ensure that the application/web server sets the Content-Type header appropriately, and that it sets the X-Content-Type-Options header to 'nosniff' for all web pages.

          If possible, ensure that the end user uses a standards-compliant and modern web browser that does not perform MIME-sniffing at all, or that can be directed by the web application/web server to not perform MIME-sniffing.
        10. GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/disclaimer.php
          Alert tags
          • OWASP_2021_A05
          • OWASP_2017_A06
          Alert description

          The Anti-MIME-Sniffing header X-Content-Type-Options was not set to 'nosniff'. This allows older versions of Internet Explorer and Chrome to perform MIME-sniffing on the response body, potentially causing the response body to be interpreted and displayed as a content type other than the declared content type. Current (early 2014) and legacy versions of Firefox will use the declared content type (if one is set), rather than performing MIME-sniffing.
          Other info

          This issue still applies to error type pages (401, 403, 500, etc.) as those pages are often still affected by injection issues, in which case there is still concern for browsers sniffing pages away from their actual content type.

          At "High" threshold this scan rule will not alert on client or server error responses.
          Request
          Request line and header section (257 bytes) 
          GET http://testphp.vulnweb.com/disclaimer.php HTTP/1.1
Host: testphp.vulnweb.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:92.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/92.0
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Referer: http://testphp.vulnweb.com
          Request body (0 bytes)
          Response
          Status line and header section (200 bytes) 
          HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.19.0
Date: Thu, 20 Jan 2022 18:42:48 GMT
Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
Connection: keep-alive
X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.40-38+ubuntu20.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
          Response body (5524 bytes) 
          <!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01 Transitional//EN"
"http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/loose.dtd">

<head>

function MM_reloadPage(init) {  //reloads the window if Nav4 resized
  if (init==true) with (navigator) {if ((appName=="Netscape")&&(parseInt(appVersion)==4)) {
    document.MM_pgW=innerWidth; document.MM_pgH=innerHeight; onresize=MM_reloadPage; }}
  else if (innerWidth!=document.MM_pgW || innerHeight!=document.MM_pgH) location.reload();
}
MM_reloadPage(true);
//-->
</script>

<div id="content">
	<h2 id="pageName">Disclaimer</h2>
	  <div class="story">
		<h6>Please read carefully</h6>
		<p>This website is created to demonstrate the abilities of Acunetix new product <strong>WEB Vulnerability Scanner</strong>.</p>
		It is not intended to be a real online shop. Also this website was constructed with common web programming errors so it is buggy.
		<p>Please do not post any confidential information on this site. Do not give any creditcard number or real address, nor e-mail or
		website addresses.</p>
		<p>Information you post on this site are by no means private nor protected!</p>
		<p>All images on this site were generated with fre software <a href="http://www.eclectasy.com/Fractal-Explorer/index.html" target="_blank">
		<strong>Fractal Explorer</strong></a>.</p>
	  </div>
</div>
